title: A reference to a document

text: Usually, this is used for documents other than those defined by FHIR.

required: true

group.title: A reference to a document
group.text: Usually, this is used for documents other than those defined by FHIR.

extension.valueString: Document identifier as assigned by the source of the document. This identifier is specific to this version of the document. This unique identifier may be used elsewhere to identify this version of the document. null

group.text: Master Version Specific Identifier

extension.valueString: Other identifiers associated with the document, including version independent, source record and workflow related identifiers.

group.text: Other identifiers for the document

extension.valueString: Who or what the document is about. The document can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (I.e. machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of farm animals, or a set of patients that share a common exposure). null

group.text: Who|what is the subject of the document

extension.valueString: Specifies the particular kind of document (e.g. Patient Summary, Discharge Summary, Prescription, etc.).

group.text: What kind of document this is (LOINC if possible)

extension.valueString: A categorization for the type of the document. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the Document Type.

group.text: Categorization of Document

extension.valueString: Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document.

group.text: Who and/or what authored the document

extension.valueString: Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the document.
A reference to a domain or server that manages policies under which the document is accessed and/or made available. null

question.text: Manages access policies for the document

extension.valueString: Which person or organization authenticates that this document is valid. null

group.text: Who/What authenticated the document

extension.valueString: When the document reference was created.
The status of this document reference. null

group.text: current | superceded | entered in error

extension.valueString: The status of the underlying document. null

group.text: preliminary | final | appended | amended | entered in error

extension.valueString: Relationships that this document has with other document references that already exist.
The type of relationship that this document has with anther document.

group.text: replaces | transforms | signs | appends

extension.valueString: The target document of this relationship. null
Human-readable description of the source document. This is sometimes known as the "title".
A code specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document.

group.text: Sensitivity of source document

extension.valueString: The primary language in which the source document is written. null

group.text: The marked primary language for the document

question.text: The marked primary language for the document

extension.valueString: The mime type of the source document.

group.text: Mime type, + maybe character encoding

extension.valueString: An identifier that identifies that the format and content of the document conforms to additional rules beyond the base format indicated in the mimeType.
The size of the source document this reference refers to in bytes. null

question.text: Size of the document in bytes

extension.valueString: A hash of the source document to ensure that changes have not occurred.
A url at which the document can be accessed. null
A description of a service call that can be used to retrieve the document.

group.title: If access is not fully described by location
group.text: If a document can be accessed by either a service or directly by a URL (i.e. an XDS repository with an MHD access point, or a DICOM network with a WADO portal) just provide the URL.

extension.valueString: The type of the service that can be used to access the documents.

group.text: Type of service (i.e. XDS.b)

extension.valueString: Where the service end-point is located.

question.text: Where service is located (usually a URL)

extension.valueString: A list of named parameters that is used in the service call.

group.title: Service call parameters
group.text: The interpretation of the parameters, and how to convert them into a proper service call, is dependent on the type of the service, and needs to be specified in an implementation guide somewhere.

extension.valueString: The name of a parameter. null
The value of the named parameter. null
The clinical context in which the document was prepared.

group.title: Clinical context of document
group.text: These values are primarily added to help with searching for interesting/relevant documents.

extension.valueString: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented. In some cases, the event is inherent in the typeCode, such as a "History and Physical Report" in which the procedure being documented is necessarily a "History and Physical" act.

group.text: Main Clinical Acts Documented

extension.valueString: The time period over which the service that is described by the document was provided. null

group.text: Time of service that is being documented

extension.valueString: The kind of facility where the patient was seen. null

group.text: Kind of facility where patient was seen
